page.title: 03Mrs. Kimber Remembers (cont)
page.content: Mrs. Kimber remembers how things were in the old days. Water was taken from a well. Once she knocked a man's hat into the well by accident. If the bucket fell in they used somthing called a dogrod to fish it out. The village then had three shops and a tea garden. There was an old tree by the crossroads that came down because it was hollow. The war memorial was moved to the church when the road was widened. The villagers respected the Earl who lived in the manor by the lake. He gave food to the sick, and when the children heard his horse and cart going to the shop, they knew there would be sweets for them. There used to be a gypsy camp-site in the village. The caravans were painted brightly. Travellers passed through the village and begged for food.
